Description: Fragment of rim and cul of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with one band in added white near top of sherd and two more on cul; exterior: legs of goat walking to right; dotted circle and rising triangle as filling ornament; below, in handle zone, dotted concentric circles between narrow bands; below, one wide band above maeander pattern.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 70, p. 237, no. 162, pl. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0146) (phase 2)
